text:
Question 89) UTQIAGVIK residents spent two months almost completely in the dark in the inhabitants of this small city in Alaska - the northern state of the United States - they are already used to long nights without seeing daylight. On November 18, 2018, its just over 4,000 inhabitants saw the last sunset of the year. The next opportunity to see the daylight took place on January 23, 2019, at 1 pm 04 min (local time).
The phenomenon described is related to the fact that the mentioned city has a geographical position conditioned by
A) continentality.
B) maritimacy.
C) Longitude.
D) latitude.
E) altitude.
